00021 #ifndef _MMDataSetDataWriter_HEADER_
00022 #define _MMDataSetDataWriter_HEADER_
00023 
00024 /*! \file MMDataSetDataWriter.h This file defines a class that writes the data section of a DataSet using Windows memory-mapping.
00025  */
00026 
00027 #include "calvin_files/data/src/DataSetHeader.h"
00028 #include "calvin_files/data/src/MemMapFile.h"
00029 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/DataSetHeaderWriter.h"
00030 //
00031 #include <fstream>
00032 //
00033 
00034 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00035 #pragma warning(disable: 4290) // don't show warnings about throw keyword on function declarations.
00036 #endif
00037 
00038 namespace affymetrix_calvin_io
00039 {
00040 
00041 /*! This class writes a DataSet data.  The DataSet data is written to the file using memory-mapping.
00042  *      This class assumes that the DataSetHeaderWriter has already written the DataSetHeader
00043  *      to the file or more accurately, that the file has already been created by the GenericFileWriter.
00044  */
00045 class MMDataSetDataWriter
00046 {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050         /*! Constructor
00051          *      @param dsHdr The DataSetHeader object that is to be written to the file.
00052          *      @param name DAT file name.
00053          */
00054         MMDataSetDataWriter(DataSetHeader& dsHdr, const std::string& name);
00055 
00056         /*! Destructor */
00057         ~MMDataSetDataWriter();
00058 
00059 public:
00060 
00061         /*! Opens the writer.
00062          *      It closes the previously opened view and opens a memory-mapped view of the first section of the DataSet.
00063          *      @return true if it succeeded.  Method may also throw exceptions.
00064          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::FileCreateException
00065          */
00066         bool Open();
00067 
00068         /*! Closes the writer.
00069          *      This closes the memory-mapped view.
00070          *      @return true if it succeeded.  Method may also throw exceptions.
00071          */
00072         bool Close();
00073 
00074         /*! Maps the pixel data for access starting at firstRow and continuing for rowsToMap.
00075          *      @param firstRow First DataSet row to map for access.
00076          *      @param rowsToMap Requested number of DataSet rows to map.  Use GetRowsMapped for number of rows actually mapped.
00077          *      @return True if successful.
00078          */
00079         bool MapData(int32_t firstRow, int32_t rowsToMap);
00080         /*! Get a pointer to the data that has been mapped for access.
00081          *      @return Pointer to the mapped data.
00082          */
00083         char* GetMappedDataPtr();
00084         /*! Get the first DataSet row that has been mapped.
00085          *      @return Index of the first DataSet row mapped for access.
00086          */
00087         int32_t GetFirstRowMapped();
00088         /*! Get the number of DataSet rows that have been mapped.
00089          *      @return The number of DataSet rows mapped for access.
00090          */
00091         int32_t GetRowsMapped();
00092         /*! Get the suggested maximum number of DataSet rows to map.
00093          *      @return The suggested maximum number of DataSet rows to map.
00094          */
00095         int32_t GetMaxRowsToMap();
00096 
00097 protected:
00098         /*! Open a memory-mapped view of the DataSet data section.
00099          *      @return True if successful.
00100          */
00101         bool OpenData();
00102 
00103 private:
00104         /*! Windows memory-mapped file access */
00105         MemMapFile mmfile;
00106         /*! DataSetHeader */
00107         DataSetHeader& dataSetHeader;
00108         /*! Name of the file to memory map */
00109         std::string filename;
00110         /*! Size of the data section of the DataSet */
00111         int32_t dataSetDataSize;
00112 
00113         /*! Bytes per DataSet row */
00114         int32_t bytesPerRow;
00115 };
00116 
00117 }
00118 #endif // _MMDataSetDataWriter_HEADER_
